file_content.text: The battalion's breaking camp. They'll be here soon.
Well, at least you gave their rear guard a bit of a fight.
You're the crew Major Tyrus sent in, correct? Looks like most of you made it out.
Major? Yes, your team has secured the tunnels. No, I contacted you immediately, sir.
You're Tyrus's operative, correct? Good to see you alive.
Major? Yes, your operative is here. She secured the tunnels. No, I contacted you immediately, sir.
Major? Yes, I'm here with your operative. He's secured the tunnels. No, I contacted you immediately, sir.
He wants to know what was down there.
They were smuggling Force-sensitive youths off the planet. I killed as many as I could find.
Weak Force sensitives.
Major Tyrus? Bad news. It sounds like the Balmorrans are back in the prodigal Jedi business.
Yes, sir. Probably one of Commander Hunn's projects. Yes, sir. Will do, sir.
It was a room full of Force users. I want hazard pay for this.
[Lie] Deadly Jedi in training.
Did you copy that, sir?
Yes, sir. I'll pass on the message.
The major praises you on your stunning victory and service to the Empire and says we'll move a squad in to exterminate any survivors.
Trust me, that won't take long.
I got most of them.
Yes, now that we know we don't want the cargo, we can roll in the gas and the bombs.
Shouldn't be hard.
Right. Now that we know we don't want the cargo, the battalion will move in with gas to flush out the rest of this operation.
There's not a finer sight in the galaxy than gassed rebels running out of a cave into the waiting blasters of your own battalion.
Well--perhaps sunrises. But for those, you have to wake up early.
You don't sound excited.
Not looking forward to it?
Oh, no, far from it. The major said we will put an end to this smuggling operation, no matter the cost.
No doubt I'll be sent in to many other rebel-filled caves to see if they're booby-trapped.
So if there is a word to describe how I feel, "excited" would certainly top the list. Good day.
Similar to what you did, my lord, but without the Force on my side, it will indeed be... "exciting."
He wants to know if you made it in time.
Cave 52 has no cargo. They moved whatever it was before I entered.
[Lie] There was nothing.
Sir? We've got dust. Uh-huh. I'm certain, sir.
He's cursing about Imperial Intelligence again. You may want to sit down, this usually takes a while.
Sir? Yes, sir. I'll pass the word on.
He apologizes for the unnecessary danger. It looks like our battalion is going to be searching the other caves.
At least you'll have a clear mission objective.
Have fun spelunking.
Yes, from now until forever. When we uncover the real rebel nests, they're going to pay.
If Tyrus wants me again, tell him I'm busy with more important targets.
The major gets no more favors.
Understood. I should point out that it sounded like he thought highly of you, though.
They were smuggling out Force sensitives too weak to become Sith.
Fleeing Force sensitives.
Sir? Sounds like we have another one of Commander Hunn's projects. All philanthropy, no teeth.
Uh-huh. What about just a gas canister or something cheap? I see, sir. I'll pass the word on.
The major says "good work." We'll take it from here.
Are you going to exterminate them?
Did you say "gas bomb"?
They're no danger to anyone.
They're just civilians.
Not my decision. I just conceal myself behind rocks and make comm calls.
Take it away, then.
We'll find their nerve center soon enough. And when we do, they'll pay.
You, on the other hand, are in the major's good books. He wants to commend you for aiding the battalion.
If every soldier we had risked their neck like you, this Empire would be a much different place.
There's Cave 52. No one's moved anything out that I could see.
Quit tromping around! You're giving away my position.
